ygData.subject: Re: How to know if Anthem is really working
ygData.msgSnippet: Thank you all for the wonderful information.  I belong to quite a few mailing lists, and this one outshines them by far.  Intelligent conversation, stimulating
ygData.messageBody:
Thank you all for the wonderful information. I belong to quite a few
mailing lists, and this one outshines them by far. Intelligent
conversation, stimulating debate, and helpful hints all rolled into one
list. I am glad I found all of you. Thanks again!

Kirree
Xegony Server
-----Original Message-----
From: John Robertson <johnr@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, July 20, 1999 11:32 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] How to know if Anthem is really working


>From: John Robertson <johnr@...>
>
>
>
>Elena Glenn wrote:
>
>> From: "Elena Glenn" <braveheart@...>
>>
>> How would a combination of a tentacle whip and a Polished Granite
Tomahawk
>> be? I have both, and was planning on using them at level 17 for dual
wield.
>> Which shoud be the primary weapon, or is there a better combo? I also
have
>> a Dragoon Dirk. Any comments would be appreciated. Thanks
>
>If you have a dirk, whip and tomahawk, I would say ditch the whip and use
the
>tomahawk and the dirk, as the whip isn't a very good weapon, damage ratio
wise.
>The effect is nice, but it doesn't proc enough to make up for the general
>weakness of the weapon.
>
>In terms of which weapon should go in which hand, in terms of pure damage,
the
>dirk should go in your primary hand, and the tomahawk in your other. If
you are
>tanking though, reverse this, as the tomahawk will proc more often in your
>primary hand, and you want that sweet magic skin.
>
>Jyzan
>
>
